alert.note: Alert for East Polk; West Polk (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 29 at 5:14PM CST by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Cherokee and southern Polk Counties through 700 PM EST... At 613 PM EST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southeast of Wildwood Lake, or 12 miles south of Benton, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Murphy, Ducktown, William L. Davenport Refuge, Conasauga, Big Frog Mountain, Parksville, Hot House, Turtletown, Copperhill and Hiawasse Dam. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
